thread.title: Bill Belichick really wanted to start a 'no days off' chant
thread.title_full: Bill Belichick really wanted to start a 'no days off' chant

title: Bill Belichick really wanted to start a 'no days off' chant
text:
Bill Belichick really wanted to start a ‘no days off’ chant Bill Belichick really wanted to start a ‘no days off’ chant By Hayden Bird 2:02   
At the culmination of the Patriots’ victory parade, players, coaches, ownership and fans all gathered in Government Center to savor one last moment of the Tuesday celebration. 
Stepping forward to thank the fans, Bill Belichick then happened upon a slogan that he thought would make a good chant. 
“No days off,” Belichick repeated over and over again. Given his renowned work ethic, it was a fitting phrase: A "No Days Off" chant is the most Belichick thing ever pic.twitter.com/kIUOQKVS4P 
— Sports Illustrated (@SInow) February 7, 2017 Advertisement
